text: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the earth was without order, and empty; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let there be light, and there was light.
speaker: God

text: And God saw that the light was good, and God divided the light from the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God called the light Day and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
speaker: God

text: And God made a firmament and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament; and it was so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God called the firmament Heavens. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear; and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters he called Seas; and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth green grass, herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after its nature, whose seed is in itself upon the earth; and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And the earth brought forth green grass and herb yielding seed after its kind and the tree yielding fruit whose seed was in itself, according to its nature; and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the evening and the morning were the third day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heavens to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs and for appointed times and for days and years;
speaker: God

text: and let them be for lights in the firmament of the heavens to give light upon the earth; and it was so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God made two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night; he made the stars also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God set them in the firmament of the heavens to give light upon the earth
speaker: Narrator

text: and to rule over the day and over the night and to divide the light from the darkness; and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let the waters bring forth great quantities of creatures with living souls and fowl that may fly above the earth upon the face of the firmament of the heavens.
speaker: God

text: And God created the great dragons and every living soul that moves, which the waters brought forth abundantly after their nature, and every winged fowl after its nature; and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
speaker: God

text: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living soul after its nature, beasts and serpents and animals of the earth after its nature; and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God made the beast of the earth after its kind and cattle after their kind and every thing that moves upon the earth after its kind; and God saw that it was good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness; and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the fowl of the air and over the beasts and over all the earth and over every serpent that moves upon the earth.
speaker: God

text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth and subdue it and have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the fowl of the air and over every beast that moves upon the earth.
speaker: God

text: And God said, Behold, I have given you every grass bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for food.
speaker: God

text: And to every beast of the earth and to every fowl of the air and to every thing that moves upon the earth, in which there is a living soul, I have given all green grass for food; and it was so.
speaker: God

text: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the seventh day God finished his work which he had made, and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it because in it he had rested from all his work which God created in perfection.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the origins of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens
speaker: Narrator

text: and every plant of the field before it was in the earth and all the grass of the field before it grew, for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and neither was there a man to till the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there went up a mist from the earth and watered the whole face of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and man became a living soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God had planted a garden eastward in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is desirable to the sight and good for food, the tree of life also in the midst of the garden and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden, and from there it was divided into four heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the first is Pison; that is it which compasses the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the gold of that land is good; there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the second river is Gihon; this is the same that compasses the whole land of Ethiopia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel; this is that which goes toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God took the man and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou may freely eat;
speaker: God

text: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it; for in the day that thou dost eat of it thou shalt surely die.
speaker: God

text: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a help meet for him.
speaker: God

text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto the man to see what he would call them; and whatever the man called every living soul, that was its name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man gave names to every beast, and to the fowl of the heavens, and to every animal of the field; but for the man there was not found a help meet for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept; and he took one of his sides and closed up the flesh in its place;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the LORD God built that which he had taken from the side of the man into a woman and brought her unto the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man said, This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called Woman because she was taken out of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother and shall cleave unto his wife; and they shall be one flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the serpent was more astute than all the animals of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Has God indeed said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman answered unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden;
speaker: Narrator

text: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God has said, Ye shall not eat of it; neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
speaker: Narrator

text: For God knows that in the day ye eat of it then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was desirable to the eyes, and a tree of covetousness to understand, she took of its fruit and ate and gave also unto her husband with her; and he ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made themselves girdles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God among the trees of the garden.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God called unto the man and said unto him, Where art thou?
speaker: God

text: And he replied, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked; and I hid myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee not to eat?
speaker: God

text: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I ate.
speaker: God

text: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all beasts and above every animal of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life;
speaker: God

text: and I will put enmity between thee and the woman and between thy seed and her seed; that seed shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
speaker: God

text: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth sons; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
speaker: God

text: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife and hast eaten of the tree of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it, cursed shall be the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
speaker: God

text: thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the grass of the field;
speaker: Narrator

text: in the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread until thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken, for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
speaker: God

text: And the man called his wife’s name Eve because she was the mother of all living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD God made coats of skins for Adam and his wife and clothed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, knowing good and evil; and now, lest he put forth his hand and take also of the tree of life and eat and live for ever,
speaker: God

text: therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden to till the ground from which he was taken.
speaker: God

text: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubim and a flaming sword which turned every way to keep the way of the tree of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man knew Eve his wife, and she conceived and bore Cain and said, I have gained a man by the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she again bore his brother Abel. And Abel was a pastor of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in process of time it came to pass that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground a present unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abel, he also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD looked upon Abel and his present,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he did not look upon Cain and his present. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou doest good, it shall certainly be accepted; and if thou doest not good, sin lies at the door. And his desire shall be unto thee, but thou must rule over him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cain talked with Abel his brother, and it came to pass when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother and slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not, Am I my brother’s keeper?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, What hast thou done? The voice of thy brother’s blood cries unto me from the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now thou art cursed from the earth, which has opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: when thou tillest the ground, from now on it shall not yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cain said unto the LORD, My iniquity is greater than I can bear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I hide; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass that anyone that finds me shall slay me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD and dwelt in the land of Nod on the east of Eden.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch; and he built a city and called the name of the city after the name of his son, Enoch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Enoch was born Irad, and Irad begat Mehujael, and Mehujael begat Methusael, and Methusael begat Lamech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech took unto him two wives; the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adah bore Jabal; he was the father of those who dwell in tents and of those who have cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brother’s name was Jubal; he was the father of all those who play the harp and organ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zillah also bore Tubalcain, an instructor of every artificer in brass and iron; and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech, for I shall slay a man for my wound and a young man for my hurt;
speaker: Narrator

text: if Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy times seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and called his name Seth; for God, said she, has appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos. Then men began to call upon the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the book of the descendants of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in the likeness of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: male and female created he them and blessed them and called their name Man, in the day when they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adam lived one hundred and thirty years and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image, and called his name Seth:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years, and he begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Seth lived one hundred and five years and begat Enos.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enos lived ninety years and begat Cainan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cainan lived seventy years and begat Mahalaleel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mahalaleel lived sixty-five years and begat Jared;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety-five years and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years and he begat Enoch;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enoch lived sixty-five years and begat Methuselah;
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Enoch walked with God; and he was not, for God took him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, and begat Lamech;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years and begat a son;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands because of the ground which the LORD has cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety-five years and begat sons and daughters;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah was five hundred years old; and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth and daughters were born unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the sons of God saw that the daughters of men were fair, and they took for themselves wives of all whom they chose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for certainly he is flesh; yet his days shall be one hundred and twenty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were giants in the earth in those days, and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bore sons to them, the same became mighty men who were of old, men of renown.
speaker: Narrator

text: And GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD repented of having made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth, both man and beast and the animals and the fowls of the air; for I repent of having made them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth corrupted itself before God, and the earth filled itself with violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted its way upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me, for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thee an ark of cedar trees; rooms shalt thou make in the ark and shalt reconcile it within and without covering it over with pitch. {Heb. ransom or atonement}
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the fashion of which thou shalt make it: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, in which is the spirit of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with thee I will establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou and thy sons and thy wife and thy sons’ wives with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of fowls after their kind and of beasts after their kind, of every animal of the earth after its kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee and for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Noah, Enter thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of every clean animal thou shalt take to thee seven pairs, the male and his female; but of animals that are not clean, two, the male and his female.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of fowls also of the heavens by seven pairs, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For yet in seven days, I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every substance that I have made I will destroy from off the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah went in and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives with him into the ark because of the waters of the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of clean animals and of animals that are not clean and of fowls and of every thing that moves upon the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: there went in two by two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after seven days that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of the heavens were opened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that same day Noah and Shem and Ham and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons with them entered into the ark,
speaker: Narrator

text: they and every animal after its kind and all the beasts after their kind and every creeping thing that moves upon the earth after its kind and every fowl after its kind, every bird, every thing with wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two by two of all flesh in which is the spirit of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that went in went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him, and the LORD shut him in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the flood was forty days upon the earth, and the waters multiplied and bore up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters prevailed and multiplied greatly upon the earth, and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth, and all the high mountains that were under all the heavens were covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail, and the mountains were covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl and of beasts and of animals and of every creeping thing that creeps upon the earth and every man;
speaker: Narrator

text: all in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life of all that was in the dry land died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man and cattle and the animals and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth, and only Noah remained alive and those that were with him in the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters prevailed upon the earth one hundred and fifty days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the animals that were with him in the ark; and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters ceased;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fountains also of the deep and the windows of the heavens were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the waters turned back and forth upon the earth, and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at the end of forty days that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he sent forth a dove from him to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were still upon the face of the whole earth. Then he put forth his hand and took her and pulled her in unto him into the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he waited yet another seven days, and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the dove came in to him in the evening, and, behold, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off, so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stayed yet other seven days and sent forth the dove, which returned not again unto him any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year of Noah, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth, and Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dried.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God spoke unto Noah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go forth from the ark, thou and thy wife and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring forth with thee every animal that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl and of beasts and of every creeping thing that moves upon the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah went forth and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives with him;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the animals, every creature and every fowl and whatever moves upon the earth after their kinds went forth out of the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah built an altar unto the LORD and took of every clean animal and of every clean fowl and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD smelled a savour of rest, and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake, for the intent of man’s heart is evil from his childhood; neither will I again smite any more every living thing as I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the earth remains, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God blessed Noah and his sons and said unto them, Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every animal of the earth and upon every fowl of the heavens, upon all that moves upon the earth and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand they are delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every moving thing that lives shall be food for you; even as the green grass I have given you all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But flesh with the soul (or life) thereof, which is its blood, ye shall not eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: For surely your blood which is your souls I will require; at the hand of every animal I will require it and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man’s brother I will require the soul (or life) of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever sheds man’s blood in man, his blood shall be shed; for in the image of God is man made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, be ye fruitful and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth and multiply therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God spoke unto Noah and to his sons with him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold that I establish my covenant with you and with your seed after you
speaker: Narrator

text: and with every living soul that is with you, of the fowl, of the animals, and of every beast of the earth with you, from all that go out of the ark to every animal of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I will establish my covenant with you, that all flesh shall not be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, This is the sign of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living soul that is with you, for perpetual ages:
speaker: Narrator

text: I set my bow in the clouds, and it shall be for a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass when I bring clouds over the earth, that the bow shall appear in the clouds;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living soul of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bow shall be in the clouds, and I will look upon it that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living soul of all flesh that is upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Noah, This shall be the sign of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Noah, that went forth from the ark, were Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and Ham is the father of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the three sons of Noah; and of them was the whole earth overspread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah began to till the ground, and he planted a vineyard;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he drank of the wine and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father and told his two brethren outside.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Shem and Japheth took a garment and laid it upon both their shoulders and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they did not see their father’s nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah awoke from his wine and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; a slave of slaves shall he be unto his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall be his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and unto them were born sons after the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog and Madai and Javan and Tubal and Meshech and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Riphath and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim and Dodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands, each one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Ham: Cush and Mizraim and Phut and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Cush: Seba and Havilah and Sabtah and Raamah and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cush begat Nimrod. He began to be powerful in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a powerful hunter before the LORD; therefore it is said, Even as Nimrod, the powerful hunter before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel and Erech and Accad and Calneh in the land of Shinar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of that land went forth Asshur, who built Nineveh and the city Rehoboth and Calah
speaker: Narrator

text: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah; the same is a great city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mizraim begat Ludim and Anamim and Lehabim and Naphtuhim
speaker: Narrator

text: and Pathrusim and Casluhim (out of whom came the Philistines) and Caphtorim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Canaan begat Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jebusite and Amorite and Girgasite
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hivite and Arkite and Sinite
speaker: Narrator

text: and Arvadite and Zemarite and Hamathite; and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar unto Gaza, as thou goest, unto Sodom and Gomorrah and Admah and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Shem also, the father of all the sons of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, even to him were sons born.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Arphaxad begat Salah, and Salah begat Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Eber were born two sons; the name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joktan begat Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their dwelling was from Mesha as thou goest unto Sephar, mount of the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their descendants, in their nations; and by these were the Gentiles divided in the earth after the flood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as they journeyed from the east that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick instead of stone and slime instead of mortar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the sons of the man built.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people are one, and they all have one language; and they begin to do this, and now nothing will be restrained from them which they have imagined to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, let us go down and there confound their language that they may not understand one another’s speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the LORD scattered them abroad from there upon the face of all the earth, and they left off to build the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the name of it was called Babel because there the LORD confounded the language of all the earth, and from there the LORD scattered them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was one hundred years old and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Arphaxad lived thirty-five years and begat Salah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Salah lived thirty years and begat Eber;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eber lived thirty-four years and begat Peleg;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peleg lived thirty years and begat Reu;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reu lived thirty-two years and begat Serug;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Serug lived thirty years and begat Nahor;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nahor lived twenty-nine years and begat Terah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nahor lived after he begat Terah one hundred and nineteen years and begat sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Terah lived seventy years and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nature, in Ur of the Chaldees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves; the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and the father of Iscah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Terah took Abram, his son, and Lot, the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai, his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife, and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran and dwelt there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years, and Terah died in Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD had said unto Abram, Depart out of thy country and from thy nature and from thy father’s house unto a land that I will show thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bless those that bless thee and curse those that curse thee, and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken unto him, and Lot went with him, and Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed out of Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram took Sarai, his wife, and Lot, his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD appeared unto Abram and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land, and there he built an altar unto the LORD, who appeared unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went from there unto a mountain on the east of Bethel and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west and Hai on the east; and there he built an altar unto the LORD and called upon the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the Negev (south desert).
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a famine in the land, and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there, for the famine was grievous in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when he was come near to enter into Egypt that he said unto Sarai, his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee that they shall say, This is his wife, and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister, that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh, and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he treated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep and oxen and he asses and menslaves and maidslaves and she asses and camels.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh called Abram and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? Why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why didst thou say, She is my sister? I might have taken her to me to wife; now, therefore, behold thy wife, take her, and go away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him; and they sent him away and his wife with all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Abram went up out of Egypt, he and his wife and all that he had and Lot with him into the Negev.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he retraced his journeys from the side of the Negev even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai,
speaker: Narrator

text: unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks and herds and tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land was not able to bear them that they might dwell together, for their substance was so great that they could not dwell together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a strife between the pastors of Abram’s cattle and the pastors of Lot’s cattle; and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelt then in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee and between my pastors and thine, for we are brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not the whole land before thee? Separate thyself, I pray thee, from me; if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot lifted up his eyes and beheld all the plain of the Jordan that it was well watered everywhere, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as a garden of the LORD like the land of Egypt as thou comest unto Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Lot chose for himself all the plain of the Jordan, and Lot journeyed east; and they separated themselves the one from the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelt in the cities of the plain and pitched his tents toward Sodom.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto Abram, after Lot separated himself from him, Lift up now thine eyes and look from the place where thou art towards the Aquilon {the land of the north wind} and to the Negev {the south desert} and to the east and to the west;
speaker: Narrator

text: for all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it and to thy seed for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth, so that if someone could number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it, for I must give it unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abram removed his tent and came and dwelt among the terebinth {or mighty} trees of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days that Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of the Gentiles
speaker: Narrator

text: made war against Bera king of Sodom and against Birsha king of Gomorrah and against Shinab king of Admah and against Shemeber king of Zeboiim and against the king of Bela, which is Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were joined together in the vale of Siddim, which is the salt sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Twelve years they had served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings that were with him came and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim and the Zuzims in Ham and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Horites in their Mount Seir unto the plain of Paran, which is by the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they returned and came to Enmishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the works of the Amalekites and also the Amorites that dwelt in Hazezontamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Sodom and the king of Gomorrah and the king of Admah and the king of Zeboiim and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar) went out, and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim,
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, against Chedorlaomer the king of Elam and Tidal king of the Gentiles and Amraphel king of Shinar and Arioch king of Ellasar: four kings against five.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the vale of Siddim was full of slimepits, and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled and fell there; and those that remained fled to the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they also took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods and departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one came that had escaped and told Abram the Hebrew, who dwelt among the terebinth trees of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner; and these were confederate with Abram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his tried and experienced servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he and his slaves poured themselves out against them by night and smote them and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he recovered all the goods and also brought again his brother Lot and his goods and the women also and the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and of the kings that were with him, at the valley of Shaveh, which is the valley of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Melchizedek, king of Salem, brought forth bread and wine, for he was the priest of the most high God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he blessed him and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of the heavens and of the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and blessed be the most high God, who has delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And Abram gave him tithes of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Sodom said unto Abram, Give me the persons and take the goods to thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lifted up my hand unto the LORD, the most high God, the possessor of the heavens and of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet; I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou should say, I have made Abram rich,
speaker: Narrator

text: except only that which the young men have eaten and the portion of the men who went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre, who shall take their portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram; I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram said, Lord GOD, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed; and, behold, one born in my house is my heir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the word of the LORD came unto him, saying, This shall not be thy heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thy heir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought him forth abroad and said, Look now toward the heavens and count the stars, if thou art able to number them. And he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he believed the LORD, and he counted it to him for righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees to give thee this land to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lord GOD, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, Take me a heifer three years old and a she goat three years old and a ram three years old and a turtledove and a young pigeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took unto him all these and divided them in the midst and laid each piece one against another, but he did not divide the birds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, behold, a horror of great darkness fell upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs and shall serve them, and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
speaker: Narrator

text: and also that nation, whom they shall serve, I will judge; and afterward shall they come out with great riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in the fourth generation they shall come here again; for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that when the sun went down and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed shall I give this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
speaker: Narrator

text: the Kenite and the Kenizzite and the Kadmonite
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Rephaim
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Girgashite and the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sarai Abram’s wife bore him no children; and she had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the LORD has restrained me from bearing; I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarai, Abram’s wife, took Hagar, her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee; I have given my maid into thy bosom, and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes; the LORD judge between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her as it pleases thee. Then Sarai afflicted her, and she fled from her face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the LORD found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s maid, where didst thou come from and where wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the LORD said unto her, Return to thy mistress, and humble thyself under her hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the LORD also said unto her, I will multiply thy seed so exceedingly that it shall not be numbered for the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the LORD yet said unto her, Behold, thou art with child and shalt bear a son and shalt call his name Ishmael, because the LORD has heard thy affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man’s hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she called the name of the LORD that spoke unto her, Thou God that is seen: for she said, Have I not also here seen the back of him that sees me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the well was called Beerlahairoi; {well of the living one who sees me} behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hagar bore Abram a son; and Abram called his son’s name, which Hagar bore, Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to Abram and said unto him, I am the Almighty God; walk before me and be thou perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make my covenant between me and thee and will multiply thee exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abram fell on his face, and God talked with him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold my covenant with thee: Thou shalt be a father of many Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall thy name any longer be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for a father of many Gentiles have I made thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will multiply thee exceeding, and I will make Gentiles of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will establish my covenant between me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God unto thee and to thy seed after thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give unto thee and to thy seed after thee, the land in which thou art a stranger, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting inheritance; and I will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said again unto Abraham, Thou shalt keep my covenant therefore, thou and thy seed after thee in their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be my covenant, which ye shall keep between me and you and thy seed after thee: Every male among you shall be circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and it shall be a token of the covenant between me and you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every male in your generations, he that is born in the house or bought with money of any stranger, who is not of thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is born in thy house and he that is bought with thy money must needs be circumcised; and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the uncircumcised male whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised, that person shall be cut off from his people; he has annulled my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bless her and give thee a son also of her; yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of Gentiles; kings of peoples shall be of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham fell upon his face and laughed and said in his heart, Shall a child be born unto him who is one hundred years old? and shall Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed, and thou shalt call his name Isaac (laughter); and I will confirm my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant and with his seed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I shall bless him and will make him fruitful and will multiply him exceedingly; he shall beget twelve princes, and I will make him a great nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will establish my covenant with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abraham took Ishmael his son and all the servants born in his house and all that were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham’s house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in that same day as God had said unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that same day Abraham was circumcised and Ishmael his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of his house, born in the house and bought with money from strangers, were circumcised with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD appeared unto him among the terebinth trees of Mamre; and he was sitting in the door of his tent in the heat of the day;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, three men stood by him; and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door and bowed himself toward the ground
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, My Lord, if now I have found grace in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a little water, I pray you, be brought and wash your feet and rest yourselves under a tree;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will bring a morsel of bread and comfort your hearts; after that ye shall pass on because for this ye are come to your slave. And they said, So do as thou hast said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah and said, Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make bread baked under the ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham ran unto the herd and brought a calf tender and good and gave it unto a young man; and he hastened to dress it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took butter and milk and the calf which he had dressed and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he said, Here, in the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, I will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, behold, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard it in the tent door, which was behind him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old and well stricken in age, and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old, shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Abraham, Why did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of a surety bear a child when I am old?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not; for she was afraid. And he said, No, but thou didst laugh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men rose up from there and looked toward Sodom; and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do,
speaker: Narrator

text: seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation and that all the Gentiles of the earth shall be blessed in him?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know him, that he will command his sons and his household after him, and they shall keep the way of the LORD, to do righteousness and judgment, that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he has spoken of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great and because their sin is very grievous;
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go down now and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men turned their faces from there and went toward Sodom; but Abraham stood yet before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham drew near and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
speaker: Narrator

text: Peradventure there are fifty righteous within the city; wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are in it?
speaker: Narrator

text: That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked and that the righteous should be treated as the wicked that are far from thee. Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord, who am but dust and ashes;
speaker: Narrator

text: peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous: wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five? And he said, If I find there forty-five, I will not destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spoke unto him yet again, and said, Peradventure there shall be forty found there. And he said, I will not do it for forty’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, Oh let not the Lord now be angry if I shall speak; peradventure there shall thirty be found there. And he said, I will not do it if I find thirty there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord; peradventure there shall be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for twenty’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once; peradventure ten shall be found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for ten’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD went away as soon as he had left communing with Abraham; and Abraham returned unto his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the two angels came to Sodom at evening; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom, and Lot seeing them rose up to meet them, and he bowed himself with his face toward the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your slave’s house and tarry all night and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early and go on your ways. And they said, No, but we will abide in the street all night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he pressed upon them greatly, and they turned in unto him and entered into his house, and he made them a banquet and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But before they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom, compassed the house round, both old and young, all the people from every quarter;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they called unto Lot and said unto him, Where are the men who came in to thee this night? Bring them out unto us that we may know them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot went out at the door unto them and shut the door after him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, I have two daughters who have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you and do ye to them as is good in your eyes; only unto these men do nothing, for they have come under the shadow of my roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Stand back. And they said again, This fellow came in to sojourn and is he to lift himself up as judge? Now will we deal worse with thee than with them. And they did great violence to the man, even Lot, and came near to break the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men put forth their hand and pulled Lot into the house with them and shut the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great so that they wearied themselves to find the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men said unto Lot, Hast thou anyone else here? Sons-in-law and thy sons and thy daughters and whatever thou hast in the city, bring them out of this place;
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will destroy this place because the cry of them is waxed great before the face of the LORD, and the LORD has sent us to destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot went out and spoke unto his sons-in-law, those who were to marry his daughters, and said, Up, get you out of this place; for the LORD will destroy this city. But he seemed as one that mocked unto his sons-in-law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife and thy two daughters who are here; lest thou be consumed in the iniquity of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while he lingered, the men laid hold upon his hand and upon the hand of his wife and upon the hand of his two daughters, the LORD being merciful unto him; and they brought him forth and set him outside the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as they brought them forth outside, that he said, Escape; for thy soul, do not look behind thee, neither stop thou in all the plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lot said unto them, Oh, not so, my lords;
speaker: Narrator

text: behold now, thy slave has found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast showed unto me in saving my life; but I cannot escape to the mountain, lest some evil take me, and I die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one; Oh, let me escape there, (is it not a little one?) and my soul shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also that I will not overthrow the city for which thou hast spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make thee haste, escape there; for I cannot do anything until thou hast arrived there. Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun was rising upon the earth when Lot entered into Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD out of the heavens;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he overthrew those cities and all that plain, with all the inhabitants of those cities, and the fruit of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the wife of Lot looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning to the place where he had stood before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah and toward all the land of that plain and beheld that the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as God destroyed the cities of the plain that God remembered Abraham and sent Lot out of the midst of the destruction when he overthrew the cities in the which Lot dwelt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Lot went up out of Zoar and dwelt in the mountain and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar; and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the firstborn said unto the younger, Our father is old, and there is not a man left in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him that we may preserve the generation of our father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made their father drink wine that night; and the firstborn went in and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the next day that the firstborn said unto the younger, Behold, I lay last night with my father; let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in and lie with him that we may preserve the generation of our father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger arose and lay with him; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus were both the daughters of Lot with child by their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the firstborn bore a son and called his name Moab; the same is the father of the Moabites unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the younger, she also bore a son and called his name Benammi; the same is the father of the sons of Ammon unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham journeyed from there toward the land of the Negev and dwelt between Kadesh and Shur and sojourned in Gerar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She is my sister. And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, Behold, thou art a dead man, for the woman whom thou hast taken, for she is a man’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abimelech had not come near her, and he said, Lord, wilt thou slay also a righteous person?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did he not say unto me, She is my sister? And she, even she herself said, He is my brother; in the simplicity of my heart and cleanness of my hands I have done this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto him in a dream, Yes, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me; therefore I did not allow thee to touch her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore restore the man his wife, for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live. And if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou and all that are thine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning and called all his slaves and told all these things in their ears; and the men feared greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us and in what have I sinned against thee that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom such a great sin? Thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What didst thou see that thou hast done this thing?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place, and they will slay me for my wife’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet indeed, she is also my sister; she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when God caused me to wander from my father’s house that I said unto her, This is the mercy which thou shalt show unto me: at every place where we shall come, say of me, He is my brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abimelech took sheep and oxen and menslaves and womenslaves and gave them unto Abraham and restored him Sarah his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee; dwell where it pleases thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver; behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that were with thee and with everyone: thus she was reproved.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abraham prayed unto God; and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his maidservants; and they bore children.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD had completely closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech because of Sarah, Abraham’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD visited Sarah as he had said, and the LORD did with Sarah as he had spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in his old age at the set time of which God had spoken to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old as God had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sarah said, God has made me to laugh so that all that hear will laugh with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? For I have born him a son in his old age.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the child grew and was weaned, and Abraham made a great banquet the day that Isaac was weaned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had born unto Abraham, mocking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this bondwoman and her son; for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham’s sight because of his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad and because of thy bondwoman; in all that Sarah has said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also of the son of the bondwoman I will make a nation because he is thy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abraham rose up early in the morning and took bread and a bottle of water and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child and sent her away; and she departed and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under a tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went and sat her down over against him a good way off as it were a bowshot; for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him and lifted up her voice and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God heard the voice of the lad, and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven and said unto her, What ails thee, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heard the voice of the lad where he is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, lift up the lad and hold him in thy hand, for I will make him a great nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went and filled the bottle with water and gave the lad drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God was with the lad, and he grew and dwelt in the wilderness and became an archer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at that time that Abimelech and Phichol, the prince of his host, spoke unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son; but according to the mercy that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me and to the land in which thou hast sojourned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said, I will swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water which Abimelech’s slaves had violently taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech said, I know not who has done this thing; neither didst thou tell me, neither have I heard of it, but today.
speaker: Narrator
