text: And Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand that they may be a witness unto me that I have dug this well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he called that place Beersheba; because there they swore, both of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they made a covenant at Beersheba; then Abimelech rose up and Phichol, the prince of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham planted a grove in Beersheba and called there on the name of the LORD, the eternal God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines’ land many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after these things that God proved Abraham and said unto him, Abraham; and he said, Behold, here I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Take now thy son, thine only son Isaac, whom thou dost love, and go to the land of Moriah and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning and saddled his ass and took two of his young men with him and Isaac his son, and cut the wood for the burnt offering and rose up and went unto the place of which God had told him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes and saw the place afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide here with the ass, and I and the lad will go yonder and worship and come again to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it upon Isaac, his son; and he took the fire in his hand and the knife; and they both went together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac spoke unto Abraham his father and said, My father; and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham answered, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering, so they both went together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to the place which God had told him of, Abraham built an altar there and laid the wood in order and bound Isaac his son and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham stretched forth his hand and took the knife to slay his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the LORD called unto him out of heaven and said, Abraham, Abraham; and he said, Here am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou anything unto him; for now I know that thou doest fear God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes and looked and beheld behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns; and Abraham went and took the ram and offered him up for a burnt offering instead of his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham called the name of that place The LORD Shall See (YHWH-jireh). Therefore it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the LORD called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, By myself I have sworn, said the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son;
speaker: Narrator

text: that in blessing I will bless thee and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gates of his enemies;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in thy seed shall all the Gentiles of the earth be blessed because thou hast hearkened unto my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beersheba.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after these things that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she has also born sons unto thy brother Nahor;
speaker: Narrator

text: Huz, his firstborn, and Buz, his brother, and Kemuel, the father of Aram
speaker: Narrator

text: and Chesed and Hazo and Pildash and Jidlaph and Bethuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bethuel begat Rebekah. Milcah gave birth to these eight unto Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, also gave birth to Tebah and Gaham and Thahash and Maachah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarah was one hundred and twenty-seven years old; these were the years of the life of Sarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sarah died in Kirjatharba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan; and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham stood up from before his dead and spoke unto the sons of Heth, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you; give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear us, my lord; thou art a prince of God among us; in the best of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre so that thou may bury thy dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham stood up and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the sons of Heth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he communed with them, saying, If it is your desire that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me and intercede for me to Ephron, the son of Zohar,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he has, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it to me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Is he not rightly named Jacob? For he has supplanted me these two times; he took away my birthright, and, behold, now he has taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren I have given to him for slaves, and with wheat and new wine I have sustained him. What shall I do now unto thee, my son?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth and of the dew of the heavens from above,
speaker: Narrator

text: and by thy sword shalt thou live and shalt serve thy brother; yet there shall be a time when thou shalt have dominion, and thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him, and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then I will slay my brother Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these words of Esau, her elder son, were told to Rebekah; and she sent and called Jacob her younger son and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as concerning thee, does comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, my son, hear my voice and arise; flee unto Laban, my brother, to Haran
speaker: Narrator

text: and dwell with him a few days until thy brother’s fury turns away,
speaker: Narrator

text: until thy brother’s anger turns away from thee, and he forgets that which thou hast done to him; then I will send, and bring thee from there; for why should I be deprived of you both in one day?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these who are of the daughters of this land, why should I want to live?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him and charged him, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, go to Padanaram to the house of Bethuel, thy mother’s father, and take thee a wife from there of the daughters of Laban, thy mother’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And may God Almighty bless thee and make thee fruitful and multiply thee that thou may be a congregation of peoples
speaker: Narrator

text: and give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee and to thy seed with thee; that thou may inherit the land in which thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Isaac sent Jacob away, and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau saw how Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Padanaram, to take a wife from there for himself, and that as he blessed him, he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that Jacob had hearkened unto his father and his mother and had gone to Padanaram;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Esau, seeing that the daughters of Canaan did not please Isaac his father,
speaker: Narrator

text: Esau went unto Ishmael and took unto the wives which he had, Mahalath, the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob went out from Beersheba and went toward Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he found a certain place and slept there all night because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place and put them for his pillows and lay down in that place to sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven; and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, the LORD stood above it and said, I AM the God of Abraham, thy father, and the God of Isaac; the land upon which thou dost lie, to thee will I give it and to thy seed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt multiply to the west and to the east and to the Aquilon and to the Negev; and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, I am with thee and will keep thee in all places where thou goest and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob awakened out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place, and I knew it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was afraid and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob rose up early in the morning and took the stone that he had put for his pillows and set it up for a pillar and poured oil upon the top of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the name of that place Bethel, since the name of that city was called Luz at first.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me and will keep me in this way that I go and will give me bread to eat and clothing to put on
speaker: Narrator

text: so that I come again to my father’s house in peace, then shall the LORD be my God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God’s house; and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth part unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob walked on and came into the land of the people of the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked and saw a well in the field, and, behold, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it, for out of that well they watered the flocks, and a great stone was upon the well’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the flocks gathered there; and they would roll the stone from the well’s mouth and water the sheep and put the stone again upon the well’s mouth in its place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, where are you from? And they said, We are from Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Do you know Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well, and, behold, Rachel, his daughter, comes with the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, behold, it is yet high day; neither is it time that the livestock should be gathered together; water the sheep and go and feed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, We cannot until all the flocks are gathered together and until they roll the stone from the well’s mouth, that we may water the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while he yet spoke with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep, for she was the pastor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of Laban, his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth and watered the flock of Laban, his mother’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob kissed Rachel and lifted up his voice and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob told Rachel that he was of her father’s brethren, and that he was Rebekah’s son, and she ran and told her father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son that he ran to meet him and embraced him and kissed him and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art of my brethren, should thou therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall thy wages be?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob loved Rachel and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel, thy younger daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee than that I should give her to another man; abide with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled that I may go in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Laban gathered together all the men of the place and made a banquet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the evening that he took Leah, his daughter, and brought her to him, and he went in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah, his maid, for a handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that in the morning, behold, it was Leah; and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? Did not I serve with thee for Rachel? Why then hast thou beguiled me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country to give the younger before the firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee the other also for another seven years of service which thou shalt serve with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob did so and fulfilled her week; and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her maid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah and served with him yet another seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the LORD saw that Leah was hated, he opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah conceived and gave birth to a son, and she called his name Reuben; for she said, Surely the LORD has looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son; and said, Because the LORD has heard that I was hated, he has therefore given me this son also; and she called his name Simeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me because I have born him three sons; therefore his name was called Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and gave birth a son; and she said, Now I will praise the LORD; therefore she called his name Judah and stopped bearing children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Rachel saw that she gave Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister and said unto Jacob, Give me sons, or else I will die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel; and he said, Am I in God’s stead, who has withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife; and Jacob went in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bilhah conceived and gave birth to a son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rachel said, God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son. Therefore she called his name Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bilhah Rachel’s maid conceived again and gave birth to a second son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings I have wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed; and she called his name Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing children, she took Zilpah, her maid and gave her Jacob to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zilpah, Leah’s maid, gave birth to a son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah said, Good venture has come; and she called his name Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zilpah, Leah’s maid, gave birth to a second son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah said, Blessed am I, for the daughters will call me blessed; and she called his name Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest and found mandrakes in the field and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son’s mandrakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband and would thou take away my son’s mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son’s mandrakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him and said, Thou must come in unto me; for surely I have hired thee with my son’s mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived and gave birth to a fifth son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah said, God has given me my hire, because I have given my maiden to my husband; and she called his name Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah conceived again and gave birth to the sixth son unto Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah said, God has endued me with a good dowry; now my husband will dwell with me because I have born him six sons; and she called his name Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterwards she gave birth to a daughter and called her name Dinah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God remembered Rachel and God hearkened to her and opened her womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived and gave birth to a son and said, God has taken away my reproach;
speaker: Narrator

text: and she called his name Joseph, saying, Let the LORD add unto me another son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Rachel had given birth to Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, and I shall go unto my place and to my land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served thee, and let me go, for thou knowest my service which I have done thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said unto him, Let me now find grace in thine eyes, I have learned by experience that the LORD has blessed me for thy sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee and how many livestock thou hast with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude, and the LORD has blessed thee since my coming; and now when shall I provide for my own house also?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me anything; if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed and keep thy flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will pass through all thy flock today, setting apart all the speckled and spotted sheep, and all the brown rams among the rams, and the spotted and speckled among the goats; and of such shall be my hire.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall my righteousness answer for me tomorrow, when my hire shall come before thy face; each one that is not speckled and spotted among my goats and brown among my sheep shall be counted stolen with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he removed that day the he goats that were ringstraked and spotted and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep and gave them into the hand of his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob took rods of green poplar and of the almond and chestnut tree and peeled white strakes in them and made the white appear which was in the rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the rods which he had peeled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink that they should conceive when they came to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the flocks conceived before the rods and brought forth ringstraked, speckled, and spotted sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob separated the lambs, and put with his flock the ringstraked and all the brown in the flock of Laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves and did not put them together with Laban’s sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, whenever the stronger sheep conceived, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the sheep in the gutters that they might conceive among the rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sheep were feeble, he did not put them in; so the feebler were Laban’s, and the stronger Jacob’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man increased exceedingly, and had many sheep, and maidslaves and menslaves, and camels, and asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he heard the words of the sons of Laban, saying, Jacob has taken away all that was our father’s; and of that which was our father’s, he has gotten all this glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the LORD said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his sheep
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye know that with all my strength I have served your father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your father has deceived me and changed my wages ten times, but God did not allow him to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the sheep bore speckled; and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then all the sheep bore ringstraked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus God has taken away the livestock of your father and given them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at the time that the sheep conceived, that I lifted up my eyes and saw in dreams, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the females were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of God spoke unto me in dreams, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes and see, all the rams which leap upon the sheep are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled; for I have seen all that Laban has done unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the God of Bethel, where thou didst anoint the pillar and where thou didst vow a vow unto me. Now arise, go out from this land and return unto the land of thy nature.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?
speaker: Narrator

text: Are we not counted of him strangers? For he has sold us and has even devoured all our price.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the riches which God has taken from our father, is ours and our son’s; now then, whatever God has said unto thee, do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob rose up and set his sons and his wives upon the camels;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he carried away all his livestock and all his goods which he had gotten, the livestock of his getting, which he had gotten in Padanaram, to return unto Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban had gone to shear his sheep; and Rachel stole the idols of her father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob stole away the heart of Laban the Aramean, in that he did not tell him that he fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up and passed the river and set his face toward Mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took his brethren with him and pursued after him seven days’ journey; and they overtook him in Mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God came to Laban the Aramean in dreams by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount; and Laban with his brethren pitched in Mount Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away my heart and carried away my daughters as captives taken with the sword?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why didst thou flee away secretly and steal away from me and didst not tell me that I might have sent thee away with mirth and with songs with tambourine and with harp?
speaker: Narrator

text: And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt, but the God of your father spoke unto me last night, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, that thou art leaving, because thy desire is after thy father’s house, yet why hast thou stolen my gods?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid; for I said, Peradventure thou would take by force thy daughters from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let them not live; before our brethren discern what is thine with me and take it to thee. For Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban went into Jacob’s tent and into Leah’s tent, and into the two maidservants’ tents, but he did not find them. Then he went out of Leah’s tent and came to Rachel’s tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Rachel took the images and put them in a camel’s saddle and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent but did not find them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but did not find the images.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob was wroth and contended with Laban, and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? What is my sin that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? Set it here before my brethren and thy brethren that they may judge between us both.
speaker: Narrator

text: These twenty years I have been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not aborted their young, and I have not eaten the rams of thy flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which was torn of beasts I did not bring unto thee; I bore the sin; thou didst require of my hand that which was stolen, whether by day or by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: By day the drought consumed me, and by night, the frost; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters and six years for thy flock; and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, were not with me, surely thou would send me away now empty. God has seen my affliction and the work of my hands and rebuked thee last night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these sons are my sons, and these sheep are my sheep, and all that thou seest is mine; and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their sons unto whom they have given birth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou, and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob took a stone and set it up for a pillar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones and made a heap; and they ate there upon the heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban called it Jegarsahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee when we are absent one from another.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness between me and thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have raised up between me and thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: let this heap be witness and this pillar be witness that I will not pass over this heap against thee and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar against me, for harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their fathers, judge between us. And Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount and called his brethren to eat bread; and they ate bread and slept in the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning Laban rose up and kissed his sons and his daughters and blessed them; and Laban departed and returned unto his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God’s host; and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau: Thy slave Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban and stayed there until now;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have oxen and asses, flocks, and menslaves, and womenslaves; and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he comes to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed, and he divided the people that were with him, and the sheep and the cows and the camels, into two bands
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, If Esau comes to the one company and smites it, then the other company which is left shall escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, the LORD who said unto me, Return unto thy country and to thy kindred, and I will deal well with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies and of all the truth which thou hast showed unto thy slave; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan and now I am become two bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau, for I fear him lest he come and smite me and the mother with the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast said, I will surely do thee good and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lodged there that same night and took of that which came to his hand as a present for Esau his brother:
speaker: Narrator

text: two hundred she goats and twenty he goats, two hundred sheep and twenty rams,
speaker: Narrator

text: thirty milk camels with their colts, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty she asses, and ten foals.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he delivered them into the hand of his slaves, every drove by themselves and said unto his slaves, Pass before me and put a space between drove and drove.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau, my brother, meets thee and asks thee, saying, Whose art thou? And where goest thou? And for whom are these before thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say, They are thy slave Jacob’s; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau; and, behold, also he is behind us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so commanded he the second and the third and all that followed those droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau when ye find him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall also say, Behold, thy slave Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will reconcile his wrath with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the present went over before him, and he lodged that night in the company.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rose up that night and took his two wives and his two womenservants and his eleven sons and passed over the ford Jabbok.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took them and sent them over the brook and sent over all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob was left alone, and a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the man saw that he did not prevail against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was disjointed as he wrestled with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaks. And he said, I will not let thee go except thou bless me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Thy name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for thou hast fought with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob asked him and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Why dost thou ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel; for I have seen God face to face, and my soul was saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he passed over Penuel, the sun rose upon him, and he limped upon his thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the sons of Israel do not eat of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day, because he touched the hollow of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew that shrank.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, Esau came and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah and unto Rachel and unto the two handmaids.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the handmaids and their children in front, and Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he passed over in front of them and bowed himself to the ground seven times until he came near to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau ran to meet him and embraced him and fell on his neck and kissed him, and they wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifted up his eyes and saw the women and the children and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The children whom God hath graciously given thy slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Leah also with her children came near and bowed themselves; and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they also bowed themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, What meanest thou by all these droves which I met? And he said, To find grace in the sight of my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep what thou hast unto thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said, No, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in thy sight, then receive my present from my hand, that for this I have seen thy face as though I had seen the face of God; and do me the pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee because God has dealt graciously with me, and all that is here is mine. And he urged him, and he took it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, My lord knows that the children are tender, and the sheep and cows with young are with me; and if men should overdrive them, in one day all the sheep will die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass before his slave; and I will lead on softly, according as the property that goes before me and the children are able to endure until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What for? Let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth and built himself a house and made booths for his livestock; therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob came safe and sound to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Padanaram, and pitched his tent before the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he bought part of the field where he had spread his tent, from the hand of the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for one hundred ewes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there he erected an altar, and called it Elelohe-Israel (the Strong God of Israel).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Dinah, the daughter of Leah, which she gave birth unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Shechem, the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her and lay with her and defiled her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his soul was joined unto Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he fell in love with the damsel and spoke unto her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shechem spoke unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah, his daughter; now his sons were with his cattle in the field, and Jacob remained silent until they were come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hamor, the father of Shechem, went out unto Jacob to speak with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it; and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob’s daughter, a thing which ought not to be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hamor spoke with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem is joined to your daughter; I pray you give her to him as wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And make ye marriages with us and give your daughters unto us and take our daughters unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall dwell with us, and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein and take you possessions therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shechem also said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask me for as much dowry and gift as ye desire, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me; but give me the damsel to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully and talked because he had defiled Dinah their sister:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised, for among us that is a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with this condition we will consent unto you: If ye will become as we are that every male of you be circumcised,
speaker: Narrator

text: then we will give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised, then we will take our daughter, and we will be gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their words pleased Hamor and Shechem, Hamor’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter and he was the most honourable of all the house of his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hamor and Shechem, his son, came unto the gate of their city and communed with the men of their city, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only with this condition will these men consent to dwell with us that we may be one people: if every male among us be circumcised as they are circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall not their livestock and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? Only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem, his son, hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brethren, took each man his sword and came upon the city boldly and slew all the males.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they slew Hamor and Shechem, his son, with the edge of the sword and took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain and spoiled the city because they had defiled their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took their sheep and their oxen and their asses and that which was in the city and that which was in the field
speaker: Narrator

text: and all their wealth and all their little ones and their wives they took captive and spoiled even all that was in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with a harlot?
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there and make there an altar unto God, who appeared unto thee when thou didst flee from the face of Esau, thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob said unto his household and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you and be clean and change your garments:
speaker: Narrator

text: And let us arise and go up to Bethel and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and has been with me in the way which I have gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their power and all their earrings which were in their ears, and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they journeyed, and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan, that is, Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there he built an altar and called the place Elbethel because there God had appeared unto him when he fled from the face of his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak, and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God appeared unto Jacob again when he came out of Padanaram and blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob; thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name, and he called his name Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty; be fruitful and multiply, a nation and a company of nations (Gentiles) shall come out of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land which I have given to Abraham and to Isaac, to thee will I give it and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone; and he poured a drink offering upon it, and he poured oil upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him, Bethel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they journeyed from Bethel, and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath when Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when she was in hard labour, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as her soul was departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni, but his father called him Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Rachel died and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave; that is the pillar of Rachel’s grave unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel journeyed and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine, and Israel heard of it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Leah: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s handmaid: Dan and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Padanaram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob came unto Isaac, his father, unto Mamre, unto the city of Arbah, which is Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days of Isaac were one hundred and eighty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaac expired and died and was gathered unto his people, being old and full of days, and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon, the Hittite; Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, the Hivite;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bashemath, Ishmael’s daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz, and Bashemath bore Reuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Aholibamah bore Jeush and Jaalam and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, who were born unto him in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Esau took his wives and his sons and his daughters and all the persons of his house and his cattle and all his beasts and all his substance, which he had got in the land of Canaan, and went into another country from the face of his brother Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their riches were more than that they might dwell together, and the land in which they were strangers could not bear them because of their livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus dwelt Esau in Mount Seir; Esau is Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the lineages of Esau, the father of the Edomites in Mount Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, the wife of Esau; Reuel, the son of Bashemath, the wife of Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz, Esau’s son, and she bore to Eliphaz Amalek: these are the sons of Adah, Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these were the sons of Bashemath, Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, Esau’s wife: she gave birth unto Esau Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are dukes of the sons of Esau. The sons of Eliphaz, the firstborn son of Esau: duke Teman, duke Omar, duke Zepho, duke Kenaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Reuel, Esau’s son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Aholibamah, Esau’s wife: duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah; these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Esau, who is Edom, and these are their dukes.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Seir, the Horite, who inhabited the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan; these are the dukes of the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam, and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Zibeon: both Ajah and Anah; this was that Anah that invented mules in the wilderness as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children {Heb. sons} of Anah were these: Dishon and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer are these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Dishan are these: Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the dukes that came of the Horites: duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,
speaker: Narrator

text: duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan; these are the dukes that came of Hori; by their dukedoms in the land of Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bela, the son of Beor, reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah of Bozrah, reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Husham died, and Hadad, the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul died, and Baalhanan, the son of Achbor, reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Baalhanan, the son of Achbor, died, and Hadar reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names: duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: duke Magdiel, duke Iram: these were the dukes of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession. This is the Esau, the father of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob dwelt in the land in which his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah and with the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives; and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his other sons because he was the son of his old age, and he made him a coat of many colours.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him and could not speak peaceably unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brethren; and they hated him yet the more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, behold, my sheaf arose and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about and made obeisance to my sheaf.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? Or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams and for his words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he dreamed yet another dream and told it to his brethren, saying, Behold, I have dreamed another dream; and, behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars made obeisance to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he told it to his father and to his brethren; and his father reprehended him and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren envied him; but his father kept the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren went to feed their father’s sheep in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said unto Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the sheep in Shechem? Come and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it is well with thy brethren and well with the sheep and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field; and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, I seek my brethren; tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man said, They are departed from here; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren and found them in Dothan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer comes;
speaker: Narrator

text: now therefore, come and let us slay him and cast him into a cistern, and we will say, Some evil beast has devoured him; and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Reuben heard it, he delivered him out of their hands and said, Let us not kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood but cast him into this cistern that is in the wilderness and lay no hand upon him that he might rid him out of their hands to deliver him to his father again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they took him and cast him into the cistern; and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sat down to eat bread; and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing aromas and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother and conceal his blood?
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Midianite merchantmen passed by, they took and lifted up Joseph out of the cistern and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver. And they brought Joseph into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reuben returned unto the cistern; and, behold, Joseph was not inside, and he rent his clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he returned unto his brethren and said, The young man is not; and I, where shall I go?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took Joseph’s coat and killed a kid of the goats and dipped the coat in the blood;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father and said, We have found this, recognize now whether it is thy son’s coat or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he knew it and said, It is my son’s coat; an evil beast has devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob rent his clothes and put sackcloth upon his loins and mourned for his son many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted, and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s and captain of the guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down from his brethren and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah, and he took her and went in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived and gave birth to a son, and he called his name Er.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she conceived again and gave birth to a son, and she called his name Onan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she yet again conceived and gave birth to a son and called his name Shelah. And he was at Chezib, when she gave birth to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD and the LORD slew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife and marry her and raise up seed to thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Onan knew that the seed would not be his, and it came to pass when he went in unto his brother’s wife, that he corrupted it on the ground, to not give seed to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD, and he slew him also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said to Tamar, his daughter-in-law, Remain a widow at thy father’s house until Shelah, my son, is grown; for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many days passed and Judah’s wife, the daughter of Shuah, died; and Judah was comforted and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah, the Adullamite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold, thy father-in-law goes up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she took off her widow’s garments and covered herself with a veil and wrapped herself and sat by the gate to the waters by the way to Timnath, for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a harlot because she had covered her face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he turned unto her by the way and said, Come now, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee (for he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law). And she said, What wilt thou give me that thou may come in unto me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, I will send thee from the sheep a kid from the goats. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge until thou send it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet and thy mantel and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave them to her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she arose and went away and took off her veil and put on the garments of her widowhood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend, the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman’s hand; but he did not find her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the cult prostitute of the waters by the way side? And they said, There was no cult prostitute in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he returned to Judah and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said that there was no cult prostitute in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah said, Let her take the things for herself lest we be shamed; behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar, thy daughter-in-law, has played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth and let her be burnt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, By the man whose these are, am I with child; and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet and mantel and staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah acknowledged them, and said, She has been more righteous than I because I did not give her to Shelah, my son. And he knew her again no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the time of her travail that, behold, twins were in her womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when she travailed, that the one put out his hand, and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out; and she said, Why hast thou brought this breach upon thee? Therefore his name was called Pharez.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward his brother that had the scarlet thread upon his hand came out, and his name was called Zarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him from the hands of the Ishmeelites, who had brought him down there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prospered man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his master saw that the LORD was with him and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him; and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house and in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left all that he had in Joseph’s hand, and with him knew of nothing more than of the bread which he ate. And Joseph was handsome and well favoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after these things, that his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he refused and said unto his master’s wife, Behold, my master does not know what is with me in the house, and he has committed all that he has to my hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: there is none greater in this house than I; neither has he kept back anything from me but thee because thou art his wife; how then can I do this great wickedness and sin against God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he did not hearken unto her, to lie by her or to be with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business, and none of those of the house were there within.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me; and he left his garment in her hand and fled and got outside.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand and had fled forth,
speaker: Narrator

text: that she called unto those of her house and spoke unto them, saying, See, he has brought in a Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me and fled and left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she laid up his garment by her until his lord came home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she spoke unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew slave, whom thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to dishonour me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when I lifted up my voice and cried, he left his garment with me and fled out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke unto him, saying, After this manner did thy slave treat me, that his wrath was kindled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph’s master took him and put him into the prison, a place where the king’s prisoners were bound; and he was there in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD was with Joseph and showed him mercy and gave him grace in the sight of the prince of the house of the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the prince of the house of the prison committed to Joseph’s hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatever they did there, he was the doer of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prince of the prison looked not to anything that was under his hand because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had sinned against their lord, the king of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh was angry against his two officers, against the chief of the butlers and against the chief of the bakers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put them in prison in the house of the captain of the guard, into the house of the prison where Joseph was bound.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them; and they continued for days in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And both of them dreamed a dream, each man his dream in the same night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were bound in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked Pharaoh’s officers that were with him in the prison of his lord’s house, saying, Why look ye so sad today?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? Tell me the dreams, I pray you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief butler told his dream to Joseph and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the vine were three branches, and it was as though it budded and her blossoms shot forth, and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head and restore thee unto thy place, and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh’s cup into his hand after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt think of me within thyself when it shall be well with thee, and show mercy, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh and bring me out of this house;
speaker: Narrator

text: for indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews; neither have I done anything here that they should put me into the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of baked foods for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket upon my head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee and shall hang thee on a tree, and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a banquet unto all his slaves, and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again, and he gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he hanged the chief baker; as Joseph had interpreted to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the chief butler did not remember Joseph but forgot him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven beautiful cows and very fat, and they fed in a meadow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, seven other cows came up after them out of the river, ugly and lean-fleshed, and stood by the other cows upon the brink of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ugly and lean-fleshed cows ate up the seven beautiful and fat cows. So Pharaoh awoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he slept and dreamed the second time; and, behold, seven heads of wheat came up upon one stalk, full and beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, seven thin heads, blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the seven thin heads devoured the seven full and beautiful heads. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt and all the wise men thereof; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was no one that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief butler spoke unto Pharaoh, saying, I remember my sins today;
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh was angry with his slaves and put me in the prison of the captain of the guard’s house, both me and the prince of the bakers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we both dreamed a dream in one night; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was there with us a young man, a Hebrew, slave to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted our dreams to us; he interpreted to each man according to his dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto my office, and him he hanged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon; and they cut his hair and changed his clothes, and he came in unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is no one that can interpret it; but I have heard say of thee that thou canst hear dreams to interpret them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me; God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river;
speaker: Narrator

text: and, behold, there came up out of the river seven cows, fat-fleshed and beautiful in appearance; and they fed in a meadow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, seven other cows came up after them, lean and very ugly in appearance, and thin, such as I have never seen in all the land of Egypt for ugliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven fat cows;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ugly, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I also saw in my dream, and, behold, seven heads came up in one stalk, full and beautiful;
speaker: Narrator

text: and, behold, seven heads, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thin heads devoured the seven good heads; and I told this unto the magicians, but there was no one that could declare it to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: God has showed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seven beautiful cows are seven years; and the seven good heads are seven years; the dream is one and the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the seven thin and ugly cows that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty heads blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the thing which I have spoken unto Pharaoh. What God is about to do he has shown unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, seven years of great plenty are coming throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it shall be very grievous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that the dream came unto Pharaoh twice, it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore let Pharaoh find a discreet and wise man and set him over the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them gather all the food of those good years that come and lay up wheat under the hand of Pharaoh to feed the cities, and let them store it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let that food be stored for the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt; and the land shall not perish through the famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word was good in the eyes of Pharaoh and in the eyes of all his slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto his slaves, Can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom the Spirit of God is?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Forasmuch as God has showed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled; only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand and put it upon Joseph’s hand and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen and put a gold chain about his neck;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he made him to ride in his second chariot; and they cried before him, Abrech Tender Father-honour this one as a precious father; and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee no one shall lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphnathpaaneah, and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On. And Joseph went out over all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh and went throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of Egypt and laid up the food in the cities, placing in each city the food of the field, which was round about.
speaker: Narrator
