text: And Joseph gathered wheat as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left off numbering; for it was without number.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came, which Asenath, the daughter of Potipherah, prince of On, bore unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh; For God, said he, has made me forget all my toil and all my father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the second he called Ephraim, For God, said he, has caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the seven years of the abundance that was in the land of Egypt were ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the seven years of famine began to come, according as Joseph had said; and the famine was in all lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread. And Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go unto Joseph; what he saith to you, do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the famine was over all the face of the earth. Then Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold unto the Egyptians; for the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the earth came into Egypt to buy from Joseph because the famine was so sore in all lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jacob saw that there was food in Egypt, Jacob said unto his sons, Why are ye looking upon one another?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is food in Egypt; go down there and buy for us from there that we may live, and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph’s ten brethren went down to buy wheat in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jacob did not send Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure disaster befall him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel came to buy among those that came, for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph was the lord over the land, and he it was that sold the wheat to all the people of the land; and Joseph’s brethren came and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph saw his brethren, he knew them, but made himself strange unto them and spoke roughly unto them; and he said unto them, Where have you come from? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph knew his brethren but they did not know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them and said unto them, Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, No, my lord, but to buy food are thy slaves come.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are all one man’s sons; we are men of the truth, thy slaves have never been spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, No, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Thy slaves are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto them, That is it that which I spoke unto you, saying, Ye are spies:
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereby ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth from here unless your youngest brother comes here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send one of you and let him bring your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison that your words may be proved, whether there is any truth in you; or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put them all together into prison for three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto them the third day, Do this and live, for I fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye are men of the truth, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison; go ye, carry food for the famine of your houses
speaker: Narrator

text: but bring your youngest brother unto me, so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, We are truly guilty concerning our brother in that we saw the anguish of his soul when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Reuben answered them, saying, Did I not speak unto you, saying, Do not sin against the young man, and ye would not hear? Therefore, behold, his blood is also required.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did not know that Joseph understood them, for he spoke unto them by an interpreter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he turned himself about from them and wept and returned to them again and spoke with them and took Simeon from them and bound him before their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with wheat and to restore each man’s money into his sack and to give them provisions for the way; and thus it was done unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laded their asses with the wheat and departed from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass fodder in the inn, he saw his money; for, behold, it was in his sack’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, behold, it is even in my sack. And their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God has done unto us?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came unto Jacob, their father, unto the land of Canaan and told him all that had befallen them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The man, who is the lord of the land, spoke roughly to us and took us for spies of the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we said unto him, We are men of the truth; we have never been spies.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, Hereby I shall know that ye are men of the truth; leave one of your brethren here with me and take food for the famine of your households and go
speaker: Narrator

text: and bring your youngest brother unto me; then I shall know that ye are not spies, but that ye are men of the truth; thus I will deliver you your brother, and ye shall trade in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, each man’s bundle of money was in his sack; and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jacob, their father, said unto them, Ye have bereaved me of my sons: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away; all these things are upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Reuben spoke unto his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I do not bring him to thee; deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he alone is left; if some disaster should befall him by the way in which ye go, then shall ye bring my gray hairs with sorrow down to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the famine was sore in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when they had eaten up the wheat which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah spoke unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down; for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel said, Why did ye such evil unto me as to tell the man that ye had another brother?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, The man asked us expressly of our state and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? Have ye another brother? And we told him according to the tenor of these words. Could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah said unto Israel, his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go, that we may live, and not die, both we and thou and also our little ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him; if I do not bring him unto thee and set him before thee, then let me bear the sin for ever;
speaker: Narrator

text: for if we had not lingered, surely by now we would have returned this second time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then their father Israel answered them, If it must be so now, do this: take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels and take the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, aromas, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take double money in your hands and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks; carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may let your other brother go, and Benjamin. If I be bereaved of my sons, I am bereaved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men took the present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin, and rose up and went down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, Bring these men home and slay an animal and make ready; for these men shall dine with me at noon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man did as Joseph bade, and the man brought the men into Joseph’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men were afraid because they were brought into Joseph’s house, and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks the first time we are brought in here that he may seek occasion against us and fall upon us and take us for slaves and our asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came near to the steward of Joseph’s house, and they spoke with him at the door of the house
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, my lord, we came indeed down the first time to buy food;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it came to pass when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, each man’s money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight; and we have brought it again in our hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we brought down other money in our hands to buy food; we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not; your God, and the God of your father, has given you treasure in your sacks; I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man brought the men into Joseph’s house and gave them water, and they washed their feet, and he gave their asses fodder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made ready the present waiting until Joseph came at noon, for they heard that they should eat bread there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which they had in their hand in the house and bowed themselves to him to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked them of their welfare and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spoke? Is he yet alive?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered, Thy slave our father is in good health, he is yet alive. And they bowed down their heads and made obeisance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifted up his eyes and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and said, Is this your younger brother, of whom ye spoke unto me? And he said, God be merciful unto thee, my son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, Why saith my lord these words? In no wise should thy slaves do according to this thing.

text: And he charged them and said unto them, I am to be gathered unto my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron, the Hittite,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field of Ephron, the Hittite for a possession of a buryingplace.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they buried Abraham and Sarah, his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah, his wife; and there I buried Leah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The purchase of the field and of the cave that is therein was from the sons of Heth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed and expired and was gathered unto his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph fell upon his father’s face and wept upon him and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph commanded his slaves, the physicians, to embalm his father; and the physicians embalmed Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of those who are embalmed; and the Egyptians mourned for him seventy days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spoke unto those of the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: My father made me swear, saying, Behold, I die; in my grave which I have dug for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee and bury my father, and I will come again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said, Go up and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph went up to bury his father, and with him went up all the slaves of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the house of Joseph and his brethren and his father’s house; only their little ones and their sheep and their cows, they left in the land of Goshen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And both chariots and horsemen went up with him, and it was a very great company.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation; and Joseph made a mourning for his father seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a great mourning of the Egyptians; therefore the name of it was called Abelmizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for his sons carried him into the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace from Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, Joseph will peradventure hate us and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sent a messenger unto Joseph, saying, Thy father did command before he died, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren and their sin, for they did unto thee evil; and now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the slaves of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spoke unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brethren also went and fell down before his face, and they said, Behold, we are thy slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto them, Fear not; for am I in the place of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God thought it out unto good, to bring to pass that which we see this day, to give life to many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore fear ye not; I will nourish you and your little ones. Thus he comforted them and spoke to their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s sons unto the third generation; the sons also of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were brought up upon Joseph’s knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die; but God will surely visit you and bring you out of this land unto the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph took an oath of the sons of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joseph died, being one hundred and ten years old; and they embalmed him, and he was put in an ark in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator
